title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Wednesday 17 January 2018 - BBC News
summary: sprinklers 'could have stopped ' nottingham station fire .
three arrested after nottingham police chase .
leicester 's iheanacho scores first var goal in england .
weather : strong winds and heavy rain expected .

documents.title: man charged over fatal street stabbing
text: man charged over fatal street stabbing

documents.title: oldham athletic 4-2 leicester city u21
text: oldham athletic 4-2 leicester city u21

documents.title: cancelled mud bath festival to return
text: cancelled mud bath festival to return

documents.title: our live coverage has ended
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: yellow weather warning issued for wind
text: the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for wind for much of the east midlands .
there is the chance of gusts of 50-60mph at lower levels and potentially up to 70mph over high ground .
gusts are likely to peak in the early hours but there could still be some tricky driving conditions around rush hour .
it will be a cold and windy night with a band of heavy rain moving eastwards overnight .
expect the strongest winds as the rain clears in the early hours and icy patches could form in places with lows of 0c ( 32f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: rolls-royce in derby 'wo n't see big change ' in restructure
text: derby will escape the worst of any rolls-royce job cuts after the company announced that it is to restructure the business , according to its boss .
chief executive warren east said : most of our derby operations are civil aerospace , which is unaffected .
`` most of the people at rolls-royce in derby wo n't really see a huge change from the big restructure , which is moving from five business units to three . ''
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: drivers told to avoid london road due to 'heavy traffic '
text: drivers have been told to avoid london road in nottingham this evening .
there are no reported accidents but traffic is a lot heavier than usual .
this is also causing delays to some of the bus services in the city .
north and south bound london road congestion is heavier than normal .
use alternative route .
ncc have changed the traffic light sequence at hooters junction # chaos
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: gp accused of sex acts on male patient found not guilty
text: a gp has been acquitted by a jury of sexually abusing a patient during a medical examination .
dr farouk patel , a married father , wept with relief when he was found not guilty of two sexual assaults upon the male patient , and causing him to engage in sexual activity without consent .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: y not music festival to return this summer
text: a music festival abandoned after its site turned into a sea of mud will return this summer .
derbyshire 's y not festival was cancelled over safety concerns in july last year after torrential downpours hit the site .

before it was halted , festival-goers shared photos and videos of the swamp-like conditions while several bands , including happy mondays , two door cinema club and the vaccines , were unable to perform .
organisers have now unveiled a new site adjacent to its former home which will `` address some of the challenges of the previous site location '' .
they said the aston hill farm venue in the peak district allowed for better access points for vehicles and promised there would be clear routes between the campsite and arena .
the festival will take place between 27 and 29 july .
author: Press Association

documents.title: hammers loan forward samuelsen to burton
text: hammers loan forward samuelsen to burton

documents.title: staff threatened with knife in shop robbery
text: two men threatened staff with knives during a robbery at a shop in matlock .
derbyshire police said the men demanded cash from the till at the one stop store in lime tree road .
the pair then ran off towards the nearby housing estate .
one man has been described as white , slim and in his mid-20s and was wearing black jogging bottoms , a blue coat and a black cap .
the other man wore dark trousers , a black coat with the hood up and had his face covered .
it happened between 19:00 and 17:30 on 5 january .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: unemployment centre loses £ 100k funding
text: a centre for out-of-work people will have to shut some of its offices after it lost £ 100,000 of funding .
the derbyshire unemployed workers centre operates 16 outreach locations across the county providing advice but says some of these will have to be closed after losing funding from the county council .
it 's very disappointing that they 've decided to do this , especially at a time when people are looking at the issues facing the poor and vulnerable . ''
derbyshire county council said it was trying to become more efficient , and wanted a new service to reach more people in all areas of the county .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: notts considering australia 's lyon
text: notts considering australia 's lyon

documents.title: tigers must shut out 'noise ' - o'connor
text: tigers must shut out 'noise ' - o'connor

documents.title: shop sold illegal cigarettes to 'keep up with competition '
text: a trader must do community work after trapping investigators who were hunting for illegal cigarettes in his city shop .
hemen khedr , 39 , took the key from the locked front door and blocked the rear exit while demanding the return of illicit goods , a court heard .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: disabled taxi price premium condemned
text: disabled taxi price premium condemned

documents.title: warning over ilkeston rape reconstruction
text: derbyshire police have warned people in ilkeston not to be alarmed if they spot their media team filming a reconstruction of a rape and attempted murder in the town tonight .
actors are being used for the filming in queens avenue , where a woman was attacked in november .
it 's due to take place between 19:00 and 21:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: fourth person arrested in murder probe
text: fourth person arrested in murder probe

documents.title: nottingham to host first ever puppet festival
text: nottingham 's first ever puppet festival will be a four-day celebration of every kind of puppetry , organisers said .
the festival - run by city arts nottingham and nottingham trent university - will be held in march at various venues across the city .
puppets on display will include giant birds , wild dogs and an iron man .
here alison duddle talks about the puppets she has made and sean myatt , senior lecturer at the university , tells us what will happen during the festival .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: man charged after hospital stabbing
text: man charged after hospital stabbing

documents.title: february unveiling for suffragette statue
text: a statue commemorating suffragette leader alice hawkins is to be unveiled in leicester next month .
it will be uncovered near leicester market on sunday 4 february .
admirers of the leicester suffragette were given a preview of how the statue will look when a replica was displayed last summer .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: former foxes midfielder gordon wills dies
text: leicester city have announced the death of former player gordon wills .
the club said the left-winger , who played for them from 1958 to 1962 , died last week .
the news comes on the same day it was revealed former foxes striker rodney fern had also died .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: rolls-royce shake-up could mean job losses in derby
text: rolls-royce has announced it 's to restructure its management and support functions - which could affect jobs in derby .
the firm describes the potential impact on the workforce as remaining to be `` quantified '' but the shake-up is part of a wider `` simplification '' of its business .
this will also affect its commercial marine operation and defence business .
the company says it 'll release further details when it announces its financial results for the past year on 7 march .
author: BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: horses mane attraction on roundabout
text: there is a new addition to the roundabout on daleside road near nottingham racecourse .
these three sculptures of lifelike cast iron horses have been put on the busy island .
it was funded by the racecourse and nottingham city council as part of a series of improvements to roads .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: three routes remain closed as more snow expected
text: the snow 's still causing trouble in north derbyshire .
three roads remain closed after snowfall : a57 snake pass , a6024 holme moss & a624 monk 's road .
b6015 re-opened .
further snow could hit high parts of county from 8pm .
gritting crews will be in affected areas - with ploughs at the ready .
take extra care .
how is it getting up winnats pass ?
hi zoe .
we 've had no reports of problems other than those given in the last update
just been across woodhead .
all clear , just very wet with localised flooding .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: road reopened after man hit by car
text: the a38 in mansfield has now reopened after a pedestrian was hit by a car earlier .
police said the man suffered `` serious injuries '' in the collision which happened at about 12:00 .
the a38 has reopened into mansfield , so buses can operate the normal route inbound .
outbound from mansfield remains on diversion for now .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: mp ben bradley 'wo n't lose role ' over blog post
text: a spokesman for theresa may has said mansfield mp ben bradley wo n't lose his job as party vice-chairman for youth over a blog post he wrote in 2012 suggesting benefit claimants should have vasectomies .
they said mr bradley 's apology over the post was the `` right thing to do '' and added he was only 22 when he expressed the views which were `` wrong '' .
in the post mr bradley , made tory vice-chairman for youth in last week 's reshuffle , hit out at what he called a `` vast sea of unemployed wasters '' .
apologising , he said he had matured since writing the now-deleted remarks , which were highlighted by buzzfeed .
author: Tony Roe
BBC East Midlands political editor

documents.title: parris v carney : who 's got the best skills & celebration ? # fapeoplescup
text: ahead of this year 's fa people 's cup , we set england women 's football stars nikita parris and karen carney the challenge to see who 's got the best five-a-side skills and celebrations .
see how they got on
then sign up yourself for the free five-a-side tournament that gives you the chance to play at england 's training centre at st george 's park and go to the fa cup final .

documents.title: tram company losing 'almost £ 1m a week '
text: tram company losing 'almost £ 1m a week '

documents.title: pedestrian 'seriously hurt ' in crash
text: a male pedestrian suffered `` serious injuries '' when he was hit by a car on the a38 in mansfield .
nottinghamshire police said it happened on sutton road at about 12:00 .
the road is closed .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man paralysed after medical blunder
text: man paralysed after medical blunder

documents.title: mission to solve mystery behind newark 's 'little house '
text: a woman from newark is making it her mission to solve the mystery behind the town 's thinnest house .
nobody is sure why the 17th century `` little house '' - sandwiched between a bank and the town hall and just 6 ft 9 in ( 2m ) wide - is still there or who previously lived in it .
as first reported in the newark advertiser , patty temple , curator at newark town hall museum , is appealing for anyone with information to get in touch .
`` what we can see is a very narrow house to the left of the original town house , '' she said .
`` it abuts the town hall building and it has three floors we are so interested in why it was left and not taken down . ''
there is little room for a full kitchen or bathroom in the property but in 1970 a toilet was fitted for princess anne 's visit .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: fly-tipping proves costly for derbyshire taxpayers
text: people who illegally dump rubbish in our county are racking up a huge bill of more than £ 175,000 for taxpayers .

figures released from the department for the environment , food and rural affairs ( defra ) also show more than one million incidents of fly-tipping were dealt with by councils in england in 2016-17 .
author: Ripley and Heanor News

documents.title: east midlands braced for windy night
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for wind in the east midlands between 00:05 and 09:00 tomorrow .
it says the whole region could see gusts of up to 60mph .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: missing teenager found safe
text: police say 14-year-old anesu cheza , who was reported missing by family earlier this month , has been located safe and well in the leicester area today .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: seven new statues added to memorial trail
text: seven new steel figures are being unveiled at markham vale near chesterfield as part of a memorial to miners who lost their lives at markham colliery .
they will form part of a trail of 106 figures that will eventually stretch from duckmanton to the former colliery site .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: join the race for the cup ! # fapeoplescup
text: and now for a promotional message from our friends at bbc get inspired .
it 's time to enter the fa people 's cup - the nation 's free five-a-side tournament that gives you the chance to play at england 's training centre at st george 's park and go to the fa cup final .
you do n't have to play regularly - like this hockey lot - or even have ever played before !
there are 18 different categories so something for everyone - find out all the details here .

documents.title: tram network is 'losing £ 1m a week '
text: the company which runs nottingham 's tram network has reported losses of almost £ 1m a week , according to latest figures .
auditors say they have concerns about tramlink nottingham being able to meet its debt payments in the future .
but tramlink says losses are due in part to a one-off exceptional charge and turnover in the year to march 2017 rose by around £ 15m .
author: Steve Beech
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: police hunt missing woman
text: a 70-year-old woman has gone missing from her home in pinxton .
police said renata slack , who was last seen yesterday morning , has links to mansfield and nottingham .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: multiple reports of a flasher near university
text: people are being urged to be vigilant after reports of a man exposing himself on several occasions near nottingham trent university 's city campus .
nottinghamshire police said the latest incident happened in dryden street on monday .
the man has been described as white , in his mid to late forties , short , of a large build and wearing dark clothing .
it is believed to have happened on a number of occasions but police say not all the incidents were reported .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: former foxes striker dies
text: former leicester city striker rodney fern has died at the age of 69 .
the news was announced by chesterfield fc , who fern also played for in the 1970s .
the club said the former player had been in a care home for the past few years after being diagnosed with dementia .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: purple fire engine hits the road
text: derbyshire fire and rescue service will have two new purple and turquoise fire engines from today .
the eye-catching vehicles are part of a recruitment drive to get people from more diverse ethnic backgrounds to join the service .
they 'll will be based at ascot drive fire station and chesterfield .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: watch : nottingham school 's huge gift for african island
text: a community in uganda is now able to drink fresh water for the first time - thanks to the fundraising efforts of a school in ruddington .
staff and pupils at james peacock school have helped to pay for two huge water tanks that collect rain water on the island of tisai .
they 've also raised money for a new school and teacher there .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: evans angered by 'dreadful decision '
text: evans angered by 'dreadful decision '

documents.title: man charged after leicester hospital stabbing
text: a 20-year-old man has been charged after a 24-year-old man was stabbed at leicester royal infirmary .
leicestershire police were called to the hospital at 02:20 yesterday .
a man from grovebury walk , leicester , was charged with wounding with intent , affray and possession of an offensive weapon .
he is due to appear at leicester magistrates ' court today .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: meeting to look at closer derby-nottingham links
text: business and political leaders from derby and nottingham are meeting today to discuss how both cities can work together more effectively .
it 's being called the derby-nottingham metro summit .
it 's hoped ways can be found to encourage economic growth and business opportunities .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : man left disabled after hospital blunder
text: a man has received £ 2m in compensation after he was left paralysed when doctors failed to spot a spinal abscess .
kevin greenfield said the money will help him to recover a degree of independence in his life .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: psychiatrist was more than four times drink-drive limit
text: a psychiatrist who was involved in a serious car crash has been ordered to pay nearly £ 2,000 for failing to provide police with a blood sample for testing for alcohol .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: your photos : snow in derbyshire
text: grey skies and snow in hathersage this morning .
thanks to smiles for the photo .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: scooter rider injured in eckington crash
text: a scooter rider has been seriously injured in a crash in eckington .
police said the crash happened near the quarry hill and bramley moor lane junction of the b6056 at about 07:25 and involved a volkswagen golf and a vauxhall corsa .
drivers have been asked to avoid the road while the recovery operation is completed .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: drop in number of east midlands nurses
text: there are nearly 400 fewer nhs nurses in the east midlands compared with three years ago .
since 2014 , a total of 7,000 have left the profession , according to bbc research - 364 fewer nurses when taking into account the number who joined .
nearly 40 % of those who left last year in our region were under the age of 34 .
sarah was a nurse in nottingham before moving to sheffield and said she 'd leave the profession if she could afford to retrain .
`` sometimes they put you on five , 12.5 hour shifts in a week and think that 's ok ``
`` you do three nights , have one day off and then you 're back on days .
i ca n't physically and mentally turn my body clock around that quick . ''
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: roads closed following overnight snow
text: the white stuff has been falling in the north of derbyshire once again .
gritters worked through night as snow fell across county with worst conditions in north , particularly glossop area .
roads closed : a57 snake pass , a6024 holme moss , a624 monk 's road .
jack-knifed lorries on a515 alsop-on-le-dale and b6105 tor side .
more
well done you guys , we know the money is n't the best but we know you do your best and it is appreciated , thank you .
thanks robert .
we 'll pass on your message .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: three arrested after nottingham police chase
text: three men have been arrested after a police chase in nottingham last night .
officers had been called out to reports of a man with a firearm in old basford earlier in the day .
police then followed a vehicle last night which crashed in shelton street in st anns .
two people were taken to hospital .
the men have been arrested on sus of firearms offences .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: sprinklers 'could have stopped ' nottingham station fire
text: the large fire which closed nottingham railway station on friday could have been out within an hour if the recently redeveloped building had sprinklers , a fire chief says .
bryn coleman , who was in charge of tackling the blaze , said sprinklers could have stopped it spreading .
the fire started in a new part of the station completed in 2014 following a three-year £ 60m redevelopment .
network rail said it was `` inappropriate to comment '' during investigations .
author: Caroline Lowbridge
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest on the roads
text: traffic lights are currently out of action at pentagon island in derby but traffic seems to be coping well .
elsewhere in the region :
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: dog rescued in south wigston flat fire
text: a dog has been rescued from a fire at a flat in south wigston overnight .
leicestershire fire and rescue service said it was called to the terrace property on canal street just before 04:00 .
the cause is `` under investigation '' .
the road was closed for a while but has since re-opened .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: leicester 's iheanacho scores first var goal in england
text: kelechi iheanacho became the first player to score a goal awarded by a video assistant referee in english football as leicester beat fleetwood in an fa cup third-round replay last night .
iheanacho opened the scoring - with a routine strike - from islam slimani 's pass .
the big talking point of the game came when the former manchester city striker initially had a goal disallowed for offside from riyad mahrez 's through ball .

but referee jonathan moss liaised with video official mike jones , who told him nathan pond 's trailing foot was keeping iheanacho onside , and the goal was awarded 67 seconds after it hit the back of the net .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: a cold and clear day with some strong winds and heavy rain later .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: join us for today 's live updates
text: good morning everyone .
it 's going to be mayram qaiser and myself bringing you today 's news , sport , travel and weather updates for the east midlands .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News
